General course objectives:
General course objectives
The goal is to introduce the students to innovation and know about methods and tools used in innovation processes. Offer the opportunity to develop own ideas through an innovation process in collaboration with external companies.
Learning objectives:
A student who has met the objectives of the course will be able to:
Generate ideas and implement an innovation project in a team setting.
Explain the concept of innovation, innovation process models and possible business models.
Use relevant development and project management tools.
Use relevant scientific literature and patent information in the innovation project.
Include relevant legislation/rules in the innovation project.
Illustrate project ideas and business potential in a brief oral presentation.
Compile a clear and informative poster describing the entire project.
Present ideas and reflect on issues in an oral dialogue with various stakeholders.
Apply an innovation process model in a innovation challenge of interest to an external company.
Content:
In collaboration with a company a business case is developed. Focus is on the students own ideas, but they will work with inside-out/outside-in innovation, which means that the final idea which is pursued in the course may come from the company or from the students. The focus will be on applying a innovation process model, business model canvas and iterative customer based development of the business case.
The course consists of lectures, reading material, group exercises and assignments and peer-reviews. A large part of the learning activities are group based and it thus crucial to participate in class.
Remarks: The course was previously offered as 26610. It is addressed to students at min. fourth semester. With time the course will supplement 42500 Engineering and Innovation. In the transition period the course will be adapted to each student depending on whether the student has passed 42500 (or similar course) or not.
